awd_titl_txt: The Mitigation of Tornado Effects Through Human Ecology
awd_abstract_narration: A comprehensive analysis will be carried out                                    of the effects of human ecology patterns in                                     mitigating the casualties, injuries and                                         economic losses caused by tornadoes in the                                      United States.  The work will comprise: a) the                                  description, in time and characteristics, of                                    several thousand events; b) the correlation of                                  the tornado events to population and several                                    social characteristics of the impacted                                          populations; c) the assessment of the effect                                    these social and physical parameters have on                                    all losses; and d) a test of the effectiveness                                  of preparedness through the analysis of the                                     net effects of codes in mitigating the impacts                                  of tornadoes.  The results of this work will                                    be applicable to mitigation measures in areas                                   prone to tornado occurrences.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
